## Goals

- Introduce classic and modern ideas on knowledge acquisition and semantic memory
- Discuss tensions between the constructs of semantic and episodic memory

### Writing Option 1: Write a QALMRI report (5 points)

For this assignment, you will write a QALMRI report for the following paper:

- Collins, A. M., & Quillian, M. R. (1969). Retrieval time from semantic memory. Journal of verbal learning and verbal behavior, 8(2), 240-247.

Submit your report via Canvas. 


### Writing Option 2: Explore your word associations (5 points)

For this assignment, you will participate in the [Small World of Words](https://smallworldofwords.org/en) association study and then reflect on your experience with the experiment. Your task is to:

1. Participate in the study and a take a screenshot of the final page.
2. Click on the "click here for details" link and view how your associations compare to others. Take a screenshot of these comparisons.
3. Reflect on your experience:
- Did the task feel hard or easy?
- Why do you think prompted you to generate these associations?
- Were there other experiences or processes that may have led to these associations?
- Did you feel that your associations mapped on to the general population? Why or why not?

Submit your assignment with the screenshots of your participation and your reflection in 250 words.
